speaker: Narrator
text: After the run, Kara approaches you at the inn's bar.

speaker: Kara
text: Not bad out there. You're getting better at this.

speaker: Protagonist
text: Thanks. I'm still trying to figure out how all this works, honestly.

speaker: Kara
text: Hah! At least you're honest about it. Most humans I've met act like they know everything.

speaker: Kara
text: You remember that day? When you made the barrier? I thought I was going to die. I'd been running from those things for months.

speaker: Protagonist
text: I still don't understand what I did. It just... happened.

speaker: Kara
text: Instinct. That's how magic works for most people. You'll learn to control it. Eventually.

speaker: Kara
text: Anyway... thanks for having my back today. It's been a while since I could trust someone in a fight.
